Coverage increased (+0.02%) to 70.681% when pulling **74a738848a3ab089e347b859d0df6350c2daaf65 on lukecwik:beam_fn_api** into **42c88f41598a49e98a2ec376edfcbf1cd8dbd9e7 on apache:master**.

Seems that after all the coder is not the problem: the problem is that Spark runner casts the CustomWindow to IntervalWindow in the merge process, hence the serialization issue with the CustomWindow downstream. I'm investigating how to fix that up.

Gonna take a look.

R: @jbonofre
Run Flink ValidatesRunner
Run Apex ValidatesRunner
Run Spark ValidatesRunner
Run Flink ValidatesRunner

@davorbonaci What do you think we should do for integrating different Scala versions into the release process? Create a new nightly snapshot Jenkins job that also deploys Scala 2.11 builds? And for actual releases we probably have to update the release instructions or do you think it's possible to automate this?

Thank you, I will merge.

Thanks for the review!

I'll look at the ICLA and sign it before my next contribution if I make another one, right now I've just addressed a couple of smaller things that caused issues in my pipeline.
Can you swap me for Luke as reviewer on this please? Luke is trying to focus on Fn API going forward as much as possible.
Ah that is nice, will do!

LGTM. I only see two simple conflicts with https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/3357, so I'm going to go ahead and merge this one now. Thank you!
Merged, feel free to close.
R: @aaltay

We populate the display data, [SpannerIO.java#L248](https://github.com/mairbek/beam/blob/e24f1585bad05d2da677c24173e7d38c9b60d29e/sdks/java/io/google-cloud-platform/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/gcp/spanner/SpannerIO.java#L248).

As long as ValueProvider implements toString it should work fine.

[![Coverage Status](https://:/builds/11995025/badge)](https://:/builds/11995025)

Coverage increased (+0.003%) to 70.67% when pulling **fa8a83f2fca66631b132e01cd28cc5f1923bf947 on tgroh:fix_coder_combine_test** into **346a77fa8e10e218109cbd100ffc12c35323d66e on apache:master**.
R: @robertwb
Regression test? (ah - noticed it is sort of a throwaway class, but is there something we can do better... like not use this combiner?)

As a side note, I find it very surprising that () | Flatten(...) produces an AppliedPTransform with no inputs, and that it is allowed in the model.  It makes the reasonable expectation that the pipeline DAG traces back to PBegin through all paths false just for this special case, which is non-intuitive.  Should we consider changing this behavior?

sure.

R: @takidau 
-R: @lukecwik
Thanks, for display data, can you add a unit test and verify that it's formatted as expected? I think other IO connectors do a bit more to format ValueProvider's into DisplayData.
This would have been caught by having Direct Runner run encoding/decoding on the accumulator, like it does for other things. Thomas, can you file a jira for that?
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-2453 is a slightly broader change but both encompasses that change and exercises currently incompletely exercised APIs of `Combine`.

LGTM

PBegin is not part of the model; technically these are simply zero-input PTransforms. PBegin is simply an artifact of the SDK. Not being able to handle the degenerate flatten would be a regression.
